1.1_Hero_Section.heading: Canadian Amyloidosis Society
1.1_Hero_Section.description: Advancing evidence-based amyloidosis care through clinical excellence, professional collaboration, and structured knowledge sharing.

1.2_Welcome_Section.heading: Welcome to the Canadian Amyloidosis Society
1.2_Welcome_Section.description: Your trusted partner in amyloidosis care, connecting patients, families, and healthcare professionals across Canada.
1.2_Welcome_Section.detailed_content: We are dedicated to improving the lives of those affected by amyloidosis through education, support, and advocacy. Our comprehensive platform provides essential resources, connects you with specialized care, and builds a supportive community for patients and families nationwide.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.content: To accelerate awareness, improve diagnosis, and enhance care for amyloidosis patients across Canada through education, advocacy, and community support.

vision.title: Our Vision
vision.content: A future where every Canadian affected by amyloidosis receives timely diagnosis, optimal treatment, and comprehensive support.

1.3_About_Amyloidosis_Section.heading: What is Amyloidosis
1.3_About_Amyloidosis_Section.description: Amyloidosis is a rare disease with life-altering consequencesâ€”but early detection can dramatically improve outcomes. The Canadian Amyloidosis Society is building a trusted national hub for clinicians, researchers, and families seeking answers.
1.3_About_Amyloidosis_Section.detailed_content: Amyloidosis is a rare but serious condition where misfolded proteins (amyloid) accumulate in organs and tissues throughout the body. Understanding the different types, recognizing early symptoms, and accessing specialized care are crucial for managing this condition effectively.

early_detection.title: Early Detection Saves Lives
early_detection.content: Amyloidosis is often misdiagnosed or diagnosed late because its symptoms mimic other conditions. Early recognition and proper testing are crucial for better patient outcomes.
early_detection.additional_info: Our directory connects patients with specialized centers and healthcare providers experienced in diagnosing and treating amyloidosis across Canada.

1.4_Directory_Section.heading: Find Specialized Care
1.4_Directory_Section.detailed_content: Find specialized amyloidosis treatment centers, experienced physicians, and clinical experts across all Canadian provinces and territories.

1.5_Events_Newsletter_Section.heading: Events & Newsletter
1.5_Events_Newsletter_Section.description: Stay informed about the latest research, treatment advances, and community events in amyloidosis care.
1.5_Events_Newsletter_Section.detailed_content: Join our community to receive regular updates, educational content, and information about upcoming events, webinars, and support group meetings.

resource_access.question: How can I access clinical resources?
resource_access.answer: Healthcare professionals can access our clinical resources through the Resources section. Some materials require registration to ensure appropriate use in clinical settings.

membership.question: Is there a membership fee for CAS?
membership.answer: CAS membership is free for all healthcare professionals and researchers. Patient and family access to support resources is also provided at no cost.

patient_care.question: Do you provide direct patient care?
patient_care.answer: CAS does not provide direct patient care. We connect patients with specialized healthcare providers and provide educational resources to support informed healthcare decisions.

collaboration.question: How can my organization partner with CAS?
collaboration.answer: We welcome partnerships with healthcare institutions, research organizations, and professional societies. Contact us at professionals@canadianamyloidosis.ca to discuss collaboration opportunities.
